ygData.subject: Re: About cancel magic
ygData.msgSnippet: i have not tested this but it appears that whatever the last spell effect you clicked on will go away... i m probably wrong though... or it may be random ...
ygData.messageBody:
i have not tested this but it appears that whatever the last spell effect
you clicked on will go away... i'm probably wrong though... or it may be
random
-----Original Message-----
From: Ziffnab MageStorm <eq_ziffnab@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, June 01, 1999 6:00 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] About cancel magic


>From: Ziffnab MageStorm <eq_ziffnab@...>
>
>You would think that the spell would remove the first NPC spell effect
>from the target....but no, it does not. I thought...I can be the great
>dispeller in UNrest and save my friends fro mthe evil hag....but
>no...all i did was remove the Daring spell a kind cleric cast on our
>now possesed tank.
>
>not much use for it unless it gets fixed.
>
>- Ziffnab
>
>--- Gregory Egan <gemd@...> wrote:
>> From: Gregory Egan <gemd@...>
>>
>> At 08:37 AM 5/28/99 -0700, you wrote:
>> >From: Ziffnab MageStorm <eq_ziffnab@...>
>> >
>> >Understand this (at least last time I tried it a
>> month ago), Cancel
>> >Magic will remove an effect at random. It is not
>> effetive because it
>> >normally removes a nice Buff you want to have on.
>> Try it out on your
>> >friends when they have 3 or more buffs on...cancel
>> them out and see
>> >which one goes first.
>> >
>> > -Ziff
>>
>>
>> This is unfortunately true, as I found out last
>> night in Splitpaw. When
>> "drowsy" was cast on me by the gnoll shaman, I used
>> cancel magic to remove
>> it, but it always removed my shielding spell first.
>> That sucked.
>>
>> Greg (Kronan)
>>
>>
